meanings.definition: A person who ladles or serves soup or other liquid food.
meanings.sent1: The ladlers at the soup kitchen worked tirelessly to serve warm meals to the homeless.
meanings.sent2: The ladlers at the restaurant efficiently served bowls of soup to the hungry customers.
meanings.sent3: The ladlers at the party accidentally spilled soup on their shoes, creating a funny moment.
meanings.sent4: The ladlers in the school cafeteria were like busy bees, buzzing around with ladles in hand.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ladlers gracefully pouring soup into bowls stayed with me long after the meal.

meanings.definition: A utensil with a deep bowl and a long handle, used for serving soup or other liquid food.
meanings.sent1: The shiny ladlers in the kitchen gleamed under the bright lights.
meanings.sent2: The chef grabbed the ladlers to scoop out the steaming soup from the pot.
meanings.sent3: The ladlers clinked together as they were stacked neatly in the drawer.
meanings.sent4: The ladlers hung on the wall, waiting patiently for the next soup to be served.
meanings.sent5: The ladlers felt heavy in my hand, full of delicious soup ready to be served.
